item.description:
Welcome to the highly lucrative world of intergalactic real-estate! In Alienation, you will assume the role of a real-estate agent attempting to satisfy various alien creature clientele. But watch out for your rival competitors, because they will surely be trying to corner the market. Finish with the most points after 3 rounds to win the game!

Players will draft a hand of 9 alien creature cards. Creature cards may have 1, 2, or 3 creatures displayed in one of 6 races: Friendlies, Meanies, Rowdies, Sleepies, Matchies, and Sunnies. Each race has very distinct personalities and interacts differently with their neighbors. On his/her turn, the starting player will take one of 2 actions:

1. Play 1 card in his/her own solar system.
 2. Play 1 card in another player’s solar system.

All cards must be played either adjacent or diagonal to the sun card. Play proceeds left. The next player then takes one of the 2 actions. Once your solar system has 8 creature cards surrounding the sun, it is full. You may now ONLY play cards in other players’ solar systems. The round ends once all solar systems are filled. The final card in each player’s hand is placed into the discard pile. Each player will now score his/her solar system.

item.description:
You are stranded in the wilderness and must gather resources and craft items in order to survive while maintaining your health and food levels.

On a turn, you perform one action (claim resources, craft item, or rest) then roll the die to see which event impacts you. You win if you craft all 5 survival items. You lose if your health or food drops to zero.

This is a postcard game. The board is printed on an oversized postcard. 12 small tokens and a d6 are not included and are required to play.

item.description:
Seeking wealth and treasures, pirates are capable of doing everything. In Piratas! you're a captain of a pirate ship and must gather enough treasure before your opponents, even if that requires robbing, pillaging and fighting!

The first to collect 5 treasures and succeed in not being robbed will be acknowledged as the great legend of the 7 seas.

During the turn, the player can take 2 actions, which are: playing a card and using its ability, buying a card from the deck or declaring a duel with another player.

If a player chooses to duel with another one, they need to choose the amount of cannons they will use and the corresponding fired cannonballs, with the winner killing all the opponent's pirates and getting to see and pick one card from the loser's hand.

Other card actions include stealing treasures, having a parrot to copy the action of another player, pillaging, fleeing from combat or even drowning another player's pirate!

item.description:
The game comes with 12 different cards, four of each kind. Players attempt to collect a "full barn" of items, animals and characters getting one of each card. Player's pick cards, trade cards, and ask others for cards to add to their collection. The "Ol' Rat" card lets a player steal a card from a another player's barn.

The game comes in a small drawstring bag with no year information. Designed and illustrated Josiah Hurst, age 15.

A slimmed down try-out version of Absacker. Where the original comes with 106 cards, this try-out comes with 48 cards.

In Absacker, everyone's trying to grab as much as they can — but you need to close the deal to get the goods.

To set up, deal the deck out to all players, with each player creating a personal draw deck, then drawing three cards for a hand. The deck consists of cards numbered 3-7. On a turn, a player lays down 1-3 cards in the center of the table, creating a pile for each number played or adding to an existing pile for that number, so the 3s go on a three pile, the 4s on a four pile, etc. When you play the third 3, the fourth 4, the fifth 5, etc., you take all the cards of that number from the table and place them in a score pile. At the end of your turn, you refill your hand to three cards.

When one player has no cards remaining in his draw deck and in his hand, the game ends, and whoever has collected the most cards wins.

item.description:
In Cinnamon Rolls, players are Christmas Market traders, trying to make enough money over the Christmas Market season to buy their friends and family awesome Christmas presents.

The game plays over the course of three or four weeks (rounds). At the beginning of each week players buy stalls, and then take it in turns to roll for customers at the market. Each stall activates on a particular dice roll, giving the owner an income, and the player who rolls must select which particular stall that this customer buys from. If you're the only player with a stall that activates on a 10, then you might get a payout even on other players' turns!

Owning some stalls allows a player to re-roll or flip one of the dice, giving them much more of a chance to activate their high-profit jewelry or luxury watch stall... while some other stalls activate every time someone rolls their number, regardless of whose turn it is. Players must pick the best combination of stalls with their limited workforce to increase their chances of earning the most money by the end of market season.

Cinnamon Rolls is a single-sheet game that relies only on a few items most gamers will already have around the house, and is intended to be printed on the inside face of Christmas cards for gamers.

A slimmed down promotional version of Vlotte Geesten using just cards.

Balduin, the house ghost, found an old camera in the castle cellar. Immediately he photographed everything that he loves to make disappear when he is haunting  – including himself, of course. Unfortunately, the enchanted camera takes many photos in the wrong colors. Sometimes the green bottle is white, at other times it's blue. Looking at the photos, Balduin doesn't really remember any more what he wanted to make disappear next. Can you help him with his haunting and quickly name the right item, or even make it disappear by yourself? If you grab the right items quickly, you have a good chance of winning...

The lightning fast shape and color recognition game that is sure to test the reflexes of kids, families and gamers alike. In Vlotte Geesten, five wooden items sit on the table waiting to be caught: a white ghost, a green bottle, a cute grey mouse, a blue book, and a comfortable red chair. Each card in the deck shows pictures of two objects, with one or both objects colored the wrong way. With all players playing at the same time, someone reveals a card, then players grab for the "right" object – but which object is right?


 If one object is colored correctly – say, a green bottle and a red mouse – then players need to grab that correctly colored object.
 If both objects are colored incorrectly – say, a green ghost and a red mouse – then you look for the object and color not represented among the four details shown. In this case you see green, red, ghost and mouse, so players need to grab the blue book.


The first player to grab the correct object keeps the card, then reveals the next card from the deck. If a player grabs the wrong object, she must discard one card previously collected. Once the card deck runs out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!

Blackjack on 12-sided Dice.

Roll for 21, one die at a time - but don't bust (go over 21).

Contains 6 D12 dice. 5 are white with red letters/numbers. 1 is red with white letters/numbers

Each die has 12 of the 13 ranks of a standard deck of cards. (The missing number varies from die to die, and falls between 4 - 8.)

The Suite Life of Zach & Cody themed game.

From the description on the back:
It's a card game that's as topsy turvy as Zack and Cody themselves. Each player has his own deck of suite life cards. When the game mat is on the "High" side, you're trying to have a higher number card than your opponent.
But throughout the game things get topsy turvy and sometimes you're trying to have the lower number. The game always ends unexpectedly when the special suite life cards show up. When that happens, the player with the most cards wins.

Balkan Gamble explores hypothetical invasions of the Balkans during WW2. There is also a scenario depicting a hypothetical Soviet invasion of Yugoslavia to unseat Tito in 1950.

This is not the same game published in Strategy and Tactics #298, Balkan Gambit, though they share almost the same title (and the same designer). Instead, it uses the Autumn Mist / Summer Lightning / Winter Thunder system where formation are activated by chit-pull which uses an almost-diceless combat with a mission matrix.
 Headquarter chits are randomly drawn, and HQs can activate units for movement and combat. After 12 turns, both sides total victory points, which are gained for occupying cities and for eliminating enemy units (depending on the scenario).

Only 30 copies of this game were produced, by BTR Games.

(source: designer)

From the publisher:

Piranhaz! Go Fish With Teeth is played in traditional "Go Fish" style, with a twist. If you have the head of a fish, you play it in front of you rummy style. Whoever has the next piece of that fish, may on their turn steal it and place that fish in front of them. Fish continue to grow and swim around the table until they are completed from head to tail. At that point a fish is yours to keep - UNLESS... someone plays an Oil Spill on you and makes you throw back your catch, Pollutes Your Catch, makes you lose a turn by making you Forget Your Bait, Checks your Fishing License and looks at the cards in your hand, Catches Everyone in the Trawling Net and everyone has to trade hands, or worst of all they play the PIRANHA and devour your catch as their own! Unless of course you already Stuffed & Mounted it to protect it! Everyone can enjoy this game where fortune can change in one round. Piranhaz! Go Fish With Teeth is a sure family favorite.

name.value: De Slimste Mens ter Wereld: Het Bordspel

item.description: Boardgame based on a Belgian TV quiz. Every player has a digital display with a timer. You start with 60 seconds and you can earn seconds with correct answers. After 4 rounds, the 2 leading players struggle for victory in the final round. In this round, you have to give correct answers until your opponent`s timer reach 0.

item.description:
â€‹In Sea of Clouds, as captain of a flying pirate ship, recruit a cutthroat crew, collect relics and unearth the best rum by gathering shares of Loot. Then send your pirates aboard enemy ships to plunder their treasure!

In each round of the game, players take turns divvying up shares of Loot to gain Rum, Relics, Objects, and Pirates. In some rounds, when ships are flying close together, they will also clash in a Boarding action, using the effects of any Pirates they picked up to gain Doubloons and plunder Loot.

On your turn, take the first of the three shares of Loot on the table, and look at it secretly. You must decide to either take all the cards in the Share then add the top card from the deck face-down to this Loot space, or to leave the Share and look at the next one. If you choose to do the latter, add the top card from the deck to the Share you declined (or a Doubloon, if there's already three cards), thus increasing its value for the next player. If no shares interest you, blindly take the top card of the deck.

The card backs give you a hint about what’s in the next Shares: Pirates to board other ships, legendary Relics to collect, Rum to be scored at the end of the game, and Items with permanent, immediate, or secret effects.

Every 4 or 5 rounds (depending on the number of players), Boarding action will occur! Add the strength of your Captain and your Pirates, apply any bonuses or penalties, and face your two neighbors! For each victory, your Pirates will gain Doubloons or steal some Loot! After the fight, all Pirates are discarded.

The game ends after 12 (or 15) rounds. Players then add the value of their Doubloons and their Loot cards to determine who’s the winner.

item.description:
Objective

Occupy all four corners of a square on the 6 x 6 grid. The winning square can be of any size (1 x 1, 2 x 2, 3 x 3, 4 x 4, 5 x 5, or 6 x 6), but must line up with the gridlines. Diamond shapes do not count. 
 Game Play

This is a two player game. Each player takes a turn placing a stone on an intersection on the grid. Black moves first, and can place the first stone anywhere. White now places a stone anywhere on the board. Blacks' second move must be located at least three rows, or columns, from their first stone. There are no restrictions on any future game moves.

If the first player elects to play in the corner on their first move they may place a stone anywhere on the board on their second.

If one player occupies three corners of a square, and can win the game on their next move, they must announce it to the other player. The game is won when a player makes a single move that produces multiple winning moves for the following turn.

You live in Hamelin, a town infested by rats. The easiest way to get the rats out of your house is to send them to your neighbors. Whenever too many rats are jammed into a house, its occupants get desperate and move out! The player who can best keep the rats out of his house wins!

item.description:
Granny is preparing to make jam - but the fruit is still on the tree. In this fun board game kids collect cherry tokens cooperatively. They are not competing each other but the worms that want to get to the fruits faster. If the basket is full, the kids win!

Game play: the active player draws 3 cards. If a worm is shown, spin the worm spinner first to know which worm needs to be moved one step closer to the cherries. After this, move the pawns on neighbouring fields - of the color shown on the cards showing leaves. There are cherry tokens showing 1, 2 or 3 cherries. If any worm reaches a cherry token the players lose. If a pawn arrives on a '1' cherry token it can be taken. For a '2' cherry token 2 pawns have to be present on the given token and a '3' cherry token can be taken only if there are 3 pawns on the same space.

Red Flags is "The Game of Terrible Dates"

In Red Flags, your goal is to use "Perk" cards to create the best date for "The Single" (the judge for this round). However, there is a catch. Players may also play "Red Flags" (bad traits) in an attempt to sabotage another player's hot date.

Each player has an opportunity to argue why their date is the best one for "The Single," who chooses which awful date wins...

item.description:
Balthasar the bee has a birthday today. Small insects of the forest prepare some birthday present for him. But they want to make it a surprise and for this they need to reach Balthasar's house earlier than he does. 
In this cooperative roll and move game players are competing against the game - trying to reach the house earlier and not get caught by Balthasar...
Whenever a player rolls the dice (a number and a color dice) and moves the figure of the corresponding color (in case a star is rolled, any figure can be moved), Balthasar also moves one space fewer than the figure did. Players can use shortcuts while Balthasar can't. When players step on an ant space they can draw a helping token (move twice, hide behind a bush, stop Balthasar for a round, choose any color etc.). On some special spaces there are one-time-only helps like a bird's or a hedgehog's help in transporting the given figure. Some birthday postcards are also left on the track - these have to be collected before Balthasar steps on this space, otherwise Balthasar finds them and there will be no surprise (the players lose).

The title roughly translates "Far, far away".

The board shows a castle with a dragon (and a captured princess) inside and a cicular track around the castle. Players roll the dice and move around on the circular track, collecting swords and items that can help fairy tale characters who will give them keys as a reward. If you have 3 keys you may try to enter the castle and fight the dragon on your way to the tower where the princess is locked...

In a war torn land, a magical land of heroic feats and epic quests, there is a place that has never felt the wrath of the ongoing and everlasting war between the five realms. Hidden in the hills of Strongcliff , deep in the shadows of a cavern lies the best kept secret for many years.

This place is called the Cavern Tavern.

Cavern Tavern is a worker (dice) placement and resource management game that is set in a fantasy world. Each player assumes the role of a worker in the tavern. Your job is to serve drinks, work in the kitchen, do chores, and on top of that try to keep every guest happy, including the nasty and greedy barkeep.

On each turn, a player can assign his dice to 1 of the 21 locations in the tavern.

These locations are divided in 6 sections. The Main area, where the guests are located and from where each player must pick up an Order, Cellar where all the ingredients that are used to complete the Orders are located, Kitchen where players can work to receive different rewards, as well as the Chores section. Also, the board features the Wizards workshop where the players can seek help for completing the Orders and Nasty the Dwarf's office where the players can go and try to suck up to the boss and badmouth a coworker.

The players will have to complete the Orders as soon as possible, because for each round they are late, they’ll receive less points than the Order's original value.

Also, for being late with the Orders, your reputation with Nasty the Dwarf is affected, something that is vital in the game.

To stand out from other workers and gain your employers favor, you’ll need to skillfully manage the orders from your customers and the resource ingredients. You’ll have to carefully prioritize your moves, and choose from what kind of work you’ll profit the most out of the situation.

So… do you have what it takes? Get ready for the biggest challenge in your life, and start working in Cavern Tavern.

item.description:
Terraofensiva is a strategy area control game where 2 player battle for supremacy over the board. There is also the variant of 3 and 4 players, which can be played with 2 copies of the core set.
In the best tradition of abstract games Terraofensiva uses limited movement and strategic placement to battle the enemy forces. Each player will be the commander of an army and try to outmaneuver the other player/s. Every army has a safe haven and a deployment zone which can be random or chosen, making each game a unique experience.

Get your tanks, infantry and parachutes corps to overcome your foes and take control of the board. Terraofensiva favors the bold!


Terraofensiva es un juego estratégico de control territorial donde dos jugadores pelean por la supremacía sobre el tablero. También existen variantes de tres y cuatro jugadores, las cuales pueden ser jugadas con dos copias del juego básico.
En la mejor tradición de los juegos abstractos, Terraofensiva usa movimientos limitados y posicionamiento estratégico para combatir a las fuerzas enemigas. Cada jugador será el comandante de un ejército e intentará superar tácticamente a los demás. Cada ejército tendrá un refugio seguro y una zona de entrada que puede ser aleatoria o elegida, haciendo de cada juego una experiencia única.

Lleve sus tanques, infantería y cuerpos de paracaidistas al combate para vencer a sus enemigos y tomar el control del tablero. ¡Terraofensiva favorece a los osados!

item.description:
The cat leaders who live in the city decided to use Cat Racing to settle the endless fights on territory, and so they have come to the forest. The mouse henchmen heard rumors of the race, and so they have schemed to use the fights among the cat fellows, who have always tormented them, to make money. Then……the usually quiet forest stadium, where cats’ and mice’s hot battles and gambles are unfolded, becomes a Cat Stadium.

You are a mice boss. Let’s lead the henchmen wisely to influence the cats as you please, and make magnificent amount of money.

item.description:
Are you ready to form the best band of the Rock'n'Roll history?

A simple and tactical game settled in the rock music world.

Each player has a secret leader card corresponding to a leader card in the centre of the table. Goal of the game is to obtain the highest fan appreciation (score) with a Band assembled aroud your own leader.

Gameplay uses a variant of draft mechanic. On your turn you keep one card for yourself, play one card to the center on the table and pass the rest. After this draft there is a round of card play (those which you kept earlier). At the end there is a scoring depending on cards played under each leader.

name.value: Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!

link.value: Shin Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!

item.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to Sanrio Game Master Monopoly. Step into the classic gaming world with this limited edition of Monopoly, as you search for the Ultimate Game Master, Hello Kitty. Along the way, player will have to visit the 7 Game Masters to collect as many Game Zones, toy houses and toy villas as they can. They will be surprised that their fates will be twisted as they roll the dice. The one who has the greatest number of Game Zones, toy houses and toy villas will be honored by the Ultimate Game Master, Hello Kitty, to become one of the Game Masters in this board game. Come take the challenge and win the throne of Game Master.

Rules for a play by mail board game, the object of which is to control the world. Includes rules for combat, treaties and negotiation, espionage and occupation of minors.

Includes a 16 page rulebook and a 22 x 35" map of the earth.

Gut Check is a game for 2-4 players where each player attempts to develop a healthy microbiome while interfering with the microbiomes of their opponents. Give your friends the plague, botulism and more! Go to work sick to get rid of a pathogen, take some probiotics, or have some lasagna (if you can digest it). The game takes 30-60 minutes to play, depending on experience and number of players.

Gut Check draws on elements from a number of games including Pandemic, Magic: The Gathering, and Dominion. While the game plays equally well with 2, 3, or 4 players the strategy changes in each case. Optimal play revolves around hand management, card cycling, striking a balance between building your own microbiome or playing cards to interfere with opponents, and timing various events.

item.description:
Relicblade is a small scale fantasy skirmish game where one player takes command of a party of heroes on their righteous quest, while the other player harnesses the brutal fury of the pig men. Brave and wicked alike are drawn to powerful relics lost in the ruins of the ancient world.

The characters are represented on the board by detailed 30mm miniatures while their statistics and abilities are shown on convenient character cards. The real tactical depth comes in as players choose from dozens of unique upgrades to specialize their characters to gain a tactical advantage. Will you choose to specialize your druid as a support healer, or upgrade her bear form into a DPS monstrosity?

Battles are fought over an unidentified magic item that has drawn the characters to that spot. When characters are finally able to seize the relic it is drawn randomly from the Relic Deck. Relics grant an unnatural boon and are used just like upgrades, however they far surpass any upgrade in power. But if the character wielding the relic is disabled anyone can pick it up.

Standard games of Relicblade are played on a 2'x2' area, and players usually only field between three and six characters. Standard games usually last around 45 minutes. Relicblade is fast paced, dynamic, and fun.

In Point Salad, you take on the role of a hungry customer trying to squeeze into a crowded salad bar to snag limited ingredients. You will be building a salad made of overlapping cards in front of you. Every ingredient has a unique scoring condition, and quantities of each are extremely limited — the servers never seem to refill the salad bar — so you've got to hurry and snag the ones that will make your salad the best of all!

In more detail, using a rondel-based mechanism, you move your meeple on your turn to one of the three salad bar stations in front of you, perform the action that corresponds to that station, then take the ingredient available there. If another player's meeple is currently located at the station you want to visit, you can bump them — but doing so allows them to leave the line and move to any unoccupied station, giving them a free ingredient and action.

Fylgia is a abstract strategy game. The winner is the player with playing pieces left on the board.

Every player has 5 pieces and the board is 8x5 big. On your turn you can only move one step diagonally. And you can also only strike diagonally. Every time you do a standard move you can change a bonus-counter one step to a max of three. To use your bonus is the only way to move in a straight line, in any direction accept diagonally. And you have to move as many steps as your bonus-counter is on. Before or after such movement your are allowed to do a standard move diagonally. After the movement is done, the bonus-counter is reduced to nil, and you have to start to get new bonus.

Letter cards are slowly turned one-by-one for all players to see. When you can spell a word, shout it out, take the cards, and place the word in front of you.

If no player can spell a word using the first three cards, deal additional cards until a word is found. You need not use all the revealed letters, but can use only as many of the letters as you need.

A player can also steal a word from another player at any time—Add letters to make a new word, or combine words from different players or from your own finished words.

name.value: Crack of the Bat Baseball Dice Game

item.description: Crack of the Bat (COTB) Baseball is a dice driven baseball game that uses player and pitcher cards with realistic stats to simulate the game of baseball. A single roll of four 10-sided dice (red, blue, green and white) provides almost all the play resolution. Different combinations of these dice (blue-white, red-white and green-white) determine if the result is read from the pitcher or batter card, and whether the result is a hit or an out. All aspects of the game - fielding, stolen bases, hit location, strikeouts, etc. - can be simulated with the COTB system.

The game components consist of eight strips, each with four letters on each side, printed in a vertical column. Four of these strips are taken at randon and arranged on a 4x4 square.
 Players try to form as many words as possible from the letters in the array, Each letter used in a word must be connected orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the next. Players score one point per letter with an extra point for any Q used. Most points wins.

name.value: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera

item.description:
From Lone Shark Games and Monte Cook Games comes The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera, an epic card game set in the far-future world of Numenera.

The Ninth World is a card game for 1 to 5 players. It can be played competitively, cooperatively, or in solo mode. Each player plays a Nano, Jack, or Glaive. Each character is described with an adjective ("I am a learned..."), noun ("...nano..."), and verb phrase ("...who rides the lightning").

Characters will explore one of the nine kingdoms of The Steadfast—or they may venture into the even stranger lands of the Beyond. Each kingdom is illustrated with a set of five region cards. Over the course of a quick five-round game, the characters will simultaneously explore the starting region on round 1, then continue out to the region on the far reaches of the kingdom. In a standard game of nine rounds, they'll then head back home on the other side of the card.
 Each round, characters will choose how much time to spend performing actions with their five skills — scouting the wilderness, tinkering with cyphers and oddities, charming allies, combating creatures, and focusing on skill advancement — and then bid against the other heroes for the choicest cards. Each phase, a character can adventure in the town, where rewards are predictable and creatures not so dangerous. Or they can head out to the wilderness, where strange cyphers have unpredictable powers and the creatures look to bash you into oblivion.

Gameplay is simultaneous and every action is rewarded with victory points. Whoever has the most points at the end is the most legendary adventurer.

In co-op mode, characters can work together to defeat the creatures and garner the relics, but there's a catch: the wilderness is trying to kill the town. Cards flip off the wilderness deck, and the characters have to take them out before the creatures destroy the town locations and the relics and quests make it impossible for them to win. Or a character can go it alone in solo mode, which is like that except no one is there to help.

item.description:
Futari Machi ("Two people town") is a 2-player game of town development.

You and your partner are assigned to do development planning for two towns that are separated by a river respectively. Let’s build colorful buildings and make a charming town to attract many residents to your own town. For example, students like to have more entertainment areas and marathon runners desire longer roads. A pair of twin babies may turn up in a town with excellent environment.

The player who has gained the most residents is the winner.

item.description:
Each player in Top That! has five wooden bits before them: a black hat, orange tube, red goblet, green coin, and white rabbit. Shuffle the deck of sixty challenge cards, then reveal one of them. Players race to stack their pieces following two rules:


 Whichever pieces on the revealed card are in their original color must be visible in the stack.
 Whichever pieces are shown in grey must be hidden somewhere within the stack.


Whoever does this first claims the card, and whoever first claims a certain number of cards wins the game!

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Strange things are afoot in Bill & Ted's Excellent Boardgame!

Collect personages of historical significance in order to pass your oral history report. But beware! Every time you bag someone, the phone booth breaks most-heinously, and your adventure through time will take a most serious turn!

Be excellent to each other...and party on, dudes!

item.description:
"Name game" in English is card game of popular family names.
There are 200 common names from 40 countries in this game.

The player who name first the country where the name is common gets the card as a point. Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name.value: State Smarts: The Card Game of National Intelligence

item.description:
From the publisher:

State Smarts is a U.S. geography card game that is both educational and fun for children yet is also entertaining and challenging enough for adults. In addition to state specific facts, kids will also learn unique characteristics about each region of the country. The game also teaches state and landmark location as well as state abbreviations.

State Smarts is more than just a game of learning, it’s also a competitive game of strategy that the whole family can enjoy. Experienced players that have familiarized themselves with the facts will quickly appreciate the element of probability that makes playing State Smarts™ so much fun.

State Smarts is a simple card game that is easy to learn and a game that can be played anywhere. There are 100 cards in the deck with about 70 different original illustrations. A game of State Smarts should last about 15-20 minutes.

A swift brutal cardgame for two players. Plenty of luck, plenty of influence -and plenty of bullets.

The game is about getting control of the different districts of Chicago. The player with the most victory points at the end of the third round wins.

At the beginning of each round place three district cards in a line in the middle of the table.

Then each player draws seven gangster card and take turn placing them by the districts. When each player has placed two gangsters in each district the shooting begins.

The shooting happens in three phases, your gangster card shows if your gangsters can shoot in each phase, in which direction the gangster can shoot and if he can dodge a bullet from any of the directions. If shot three times the gangster is killed and is removed at the end of that phases.

When all bullets are fired and the three phases has ended, you determine which player has the most influencial gangsters in each district (the most family points). The players then take each of the districts they now control.

At the end of the game the player with the most victory points win. Victory point are shown on the district cards.

item.description:
Vikerkaar minu kõhus ("Rainbow in my stomah") is a board game about healthy diet for children.

There are different vegetables, fruits and berries, proteins juice and grain cards in different colors on the cards.
Player try to get points by collecting 3 cards with different colors + protein, juice and grain cards.
Additionally player may be awarded with bonus points by cooking, helping clean the kitchen etc.

The player who has the most points when the deck is exhausted wins the game.
Catty is a trick-taking game.

Mi Tierra: New Era (My Land: New Era) is a worker placement game in which the players represent farmers that try to labor their land in the best way possible. They will have to sow and work the land and take care of their animals so they can produce goods and sell them in the different available markets.

In this second edition, players will have all the fun included in the original Mi Tierra plus more, since the second edition includes many more features like use of water for plantations, horses, new products and more. Also, instead of four players you will be able to play up to six-player games. Finally, the rules of the game have been revised to make sure that Mi Tierra gets even better.

item.description:
In Party Boss, take on the role of the backroom political operative guiding the strategy of one of America's great political parties. Nominate your cronies to challenge incumbents and manage their campaigns. You decide where your party's vast resources will be concentrated. Will your efforts to influence the electorate succeed?

Once your politicians have taken office, plot your legislative strategy for the term: select the bills to bring to the floor and how you will go about passing them. Will you use the brute force of your majority, or the crafty tactics of backroom deals and parliamentary maneuvers?

At the end of 5 cycles, the boss with the most impact on American governance wins, while the other must retire in obscurity.

Combination card-dice game created to use items in the Ashens Game fan merchandise pack, but playable with regular pieces.

Played in two phases. In the first two phases, players play cards against each other with the highest card being added to the player's War Chest, giving a points score which is carried over to the final "battle" phase in which players reduce each others scores via the roll of a die until one player's score is exhausted.

The game's name is Norfolk slang for male genitalia.

From the box box:

Using the dice, roll numbers which give you a choice of letters from the spiral to build 3, 4, and 5 letter words. Each player has his own playing board, trying to get highest score, based on word and letter values. A competitive, educational crossword game.

At the head of a secret service, you use your spy satellites (tokens of your color) to coordinate attacks on targets that you designate to your agents :
- Objectives (tiger), Sentinel (gray), enemies Agents (their color), or the Dark Agent (black), you win all their victory points when capturing them and place them in front of you;
- Equipment (object in a white disk), one shot, are taken over to be used and discarded later;
- Special actions (red with no points) Are resolved immediately and remain in place.

One or more of your agents can attack a target only if your satellites lets you see both agents and target.

When players have had them all, the number of captured aims agreed early in the game (2 to 5 on the 5 available), it ends. You can add the capture of the Dark Agent as a further condition endgame.

The player accumulating the most points wins. He adds the points of his agents still on the theater of operation. Also note that each time a player wins an aim, he takes the bonus +3 token to its previous owner.

Le Dernier Peuple ("The Last People") is a simple, quick card game for 3 to 5 players from France.

In Le Dernier Peuple, you personify a people.

Each player has a "home" card which of his/her color. You play cards to move your 2 meeples around the cards's circle and gain points.

First, you can (optional action) use a power card (those cards are collected on pickaxes). Each card has a unique effect - read it by hovering the card in your hand with your mouse.

Secondly, you have to chose between drawing 2 movement cards OR use 1 movement card then draw 1 movement card. A grey downward arrow allows you to move your meeple ; a black upward arrow allows you to move any opponent's meeple. Each arrow gives 2 possibilities : moving a meeple by the number indicated in the circle (positive = clockwise ; negative = unclockwise) OR moving a meeple toward the card with the number indicated in the square.

You'll gain points by surrounding any "home" card with your 2 meeples or with 1 of your meeple and one opponent's meeple.
 The goal is to be the first to reach 12 points.

The game is online playable at Boardgamearena.

Dexterity game for kids (fine motor skill and perspective skill).

30 Submarines in 6 colors, A grid built from 9 limiting snakes, 2 tweezers, and the game box itself as the board.

Each turn, the player roll the die to see which submarine s/he need to pull this turn (with the tweezers), however, the task isn't simple, as a grid of snakes block the way and the player most pull the submarine without moving the snakes (if the player accidentally moves any of the snakes, the turn is over).

The player with the most submarines at the end of the game wins.

Alien Crash Site is a family friendly, 2 - 4 player co-op game for ages 12+. Play lasts about 60 minutes.

A UFO has crashed in the middle of the board and Aliens are pouring out! On the outskirts of town stand your Nuke plant, Water reservoir, Hospital, and Communications tower. If the Aliens destroy some of these key locations, it's 'game over'!

In order to prevent this from happening you will need to work together to unveil ultra high tech defenses, devise master strategies, build and command forces, and - hopefully - gain access to the ultimate weapon!

Unlike other co-op games, each player controls only 1 section of the board. There will be times of calm and times of sheer panic during play.

From the publisher:

Big Wheel challenges the skills, luck and determination of 1-8 players, pitting players against players and against the board itself! The object of the game: to become a millionaire (or go broke) within the time allotted. Easily understood directions. Educational and fun for the entire family - year 'round!

Big Wheel uses a patented movement which changes the economic conditions of the gameboard randomly among depression, recession, normal, inflation and super-inflation. As a result players must change their strategy as the gameboard changes.
In Bluffing Fighter, the player superheroes compete against one another to see who outlast everyone else.

item.description:
Mandala is type of painting that represents the Buddhist interpretation of the appearance of the universe. Various mandalas are painted to embody the beliefs of Buddhism, even in Japan, ancient artifacts from the Asuka period (550-710 CE) have been left behind. In this game, the players are mandala painters working together to paint a single mandala while competing against each other’s skills. The completion of a mandala painting is accompanied by huge suffering; the painters’ minds wander in six types of world of indecision that are called the six realms. The player who makes the most splendid contribution to the completion of mandala throughout the game to express that belief will win the game.

Note: The six realms is a Buddhist concept. It includes Deva realm, Asura realm, Human realm, Animal realm, Hungry Ghost realm, Naraka realm, which are represented by the 6 cards in this game.

The Earth has dried out and civilization with it. Some of the survivors have managed to eke out a living on the Saltlands: plains left behind by a once great ocean. Adapting to their environment they use land sails with wheels on these flats. But the Apocalypse is not done with the Saltlands, from the west a storm of raiders, a terrifying Horde on gas guzzling machines approaches in search of their lost God. Only those among the first to escape have a chance!

In Saltlands, the first group of players to find and reach an exit point wins, leaving the rest to the Horde. There are no fixed teams, players can decide to co-operate or backstab each other as they see fit. Each player starts the game with a single captain but may increase his crew as the game progresses. Each crew member represents an extra life and an action each turn. Players move with their land sails according to the wind direction: being able to criss-cross slowly upwind or speed in the fastest direction, sailing on a broad reach. Each player can choose which group of raiders to move at the end of their turn until all raiders have moved. This allows players to help each other or force confrontation with the raiders. Players can fight the raiders and take their vehicles as an alternate mode of transport.

link.value: Saltlands: Lost In The Desert Expansion

item.description:
In the card game Ninja Rivals, you are ninja masters of rival clans battling to finish missions and attain victory. Collect gold by completing objectives, play tricks on your opponents, surprise them with smoke bombs. Keep an eye on the resources in your hand otherwise, you might find the next mission is out of your reach.

At the start of the game, a mission is revealed and aloud for all to hear, including objectives and any secondary objectives if available. Then each player draws 2 cards from the NINJA DECK in order. Now the mission phase begins.

Starting with the first player, each player must choose to place a card from their hand face down into play directly in front of them or pass and draw a card from the NINJA DECK.

After a player has performed one of these two actions their turn is over, if they have over 10 cards in their hand they must discard down to 10 cards. They may also immediately play surprise cards to get their hand size down.

Play continues around the table until either, one player has 5 cards in front of them when the FIRST PLAYER is about to START their NEXT turn or All players have passed in succession.

Players reveal their cards and compare scores against the mission requirements, the winner claims the mission and the gold for their clan.

MMORPGs, or Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Games, all focus on the process of acquiring loot. Sure, some of them are set in outer space where you fight galactic wars over high-tech loot, and some are set in fantasy worlds where you slay massive beasts for magical loot, but all in all the objective is the same: People just can’t seem to get enough loot. That’s where this game, Loot! Need or Greed, comes in. We are streamlining the process for you, bypassing all that needless adventuring and skipping straight to the item drops. Just like in online-play, there is a certain etiquette that needs to be followed when competing for loot with your peers, and that’s where the strategy comes in. And above all, always remember – No one likes a Loot Ninja!

Loot! Need or Greed is a dice & card game for 2-6 players. Each round, players will attempt to out-roll each other on valuable loot items that their character could use while attempting to figure out what classes the other players are equipping for. They may even be so bold as to roll on items they can’t use, but if they are caught “Needing” on items their class can’t use they could be kicked from the party – and the game!

From the front of the manual:
It's amazing what you can accomplish if you don't mind who gets the credit.

From the back of the manual:
Magnomania (some higlights):

 You are an entrepreneur for Magnus
 Establish your consultants in as many countries as possible
 Try to get 'In Business' with your projects
 Plan your strategy and make smart choices
 Collect the points you need to win Magnomania




From the first page of the rules:
In this game you'll take part in Magnus' worldwide expansion.
Are you the sharpest entrepreneur? Will you be the first one to achieve your goal?
Consider your investment decisions carefully, execute takeovers, and make sure you get the biggest share of the market.
Play Magnomania, plan, decide, and win!

The game in brief:
As a player of Magnomania, you are a Magnus entrepreneur. You travel as an entrepreneur around the gameboard and try to be the first to earn the required number of points in order win. You earn points by taking the biggest market share on a given continent and being 'In Business' internationally. As soon as an entrepreneur (pawn) arrives in a country he can begin a consultancy project. You indicate the stages of your project by a consultant (disc). When a project is completed, you as the entrepreneur are 'In Business' in that country.

Magnomania was developed and produced on the authority of Magnus Management Consultancy (since 2009 call Eurogroup Consulting) by Identity Games International B.V., Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

The Dutch word samenspel has the meaning of: working together towards a common goal. A bit odd, considering that samen means together, but spel means game, not work.

The game was published in 1987 and given to employees of the AZU (Het Academisch Ziekenhuis Utrecht or the Academic Hospital in Utrecht, the Netherlands) as a Christmas / New Years gift.

In 1989 the AZU, part of the Universiteit van Utrecht (University of Utrecht) moved to a new building. The construction of that building started in 1981 and in 1986 the first preparation were made towards the movement, which required all patients to be moved in only two days.

This game was published in 1987 and given as a Christmas / New Years gift to the employees. The name of the game (SamenSpel, working together) is a reference to the effort of the individual employees to make the moving a success.

SamenSpel is a game about collecting pieces of illustrations related to the hospital and the moving to a new building. This is done by moving a pawn on a board one step in any one direction (somewhat like a rook in chess) and taking the piece (one quarter of the full image) from the board.

The game has one pawn, one gameboard and 12 complete images (each to be divided into four segments) but no dice. The pieces are shuffled and randomly distributed over the board, putting two pieces on each area of the board, the board has 25 spaces (the center space has no image). Whoever collects the compete images first, wins the game. When moving the pawn back to the center space, a player can "claim" a segment of an image of another player, provided he/she already owns at least one segment himself/herself.

item.description:
You've come to the arena stunning with its dominance over the city. There is no building, which would overshadow it. From the battlefield to the ceiling it is crowded with spectators dressed in the color of the programmer clans. The inner ring is simple. Floor filled with sand, the only apparent thing is the ellipse, which always turns on the power shield protecting the spectators. There are usually fighting two teams in such battlefield, at least one robot at each side led by a programmer. Will you become one of those famous programmers who shout commands to their robots and fight for the title? Build your deck so you can use your strategy toward winning in tournaments of RobotiCS.

RobotiCS strategic deck-building card game offers to every player an opportunity to become a Programmer of majestic robots which are fighting with each other in a battle duels. Every player starts with the same starting deck and develops it and its strategy during the game (= deck-building system).

RobotiCS card game is about strategic combat of α-Robots supported by their Programmers. α-Robots are loosing their hit and shield points, whilst Programmers are receiving exhaustion counters. During the game players are combining their powerful abilities. But α-Robots can carry only one piece of each equipment, therefore players need to purchase β-Robots. The game can be influenced by Action and Reaction Program cards with immediate effects. There are being arisen many strategies during the games such as discard, healing, multiplication of β-Robots, agro, etc. 203 cards guarantee always countless different combinations.

RobotiCS card game is optimized for 2 players. But families or friends could play it also in a group of 3 or 4 players. Easy understandable structure of game play is based on building the strategy of the deck during the game. It enables the player to react to the tactical actions of his/her opponent. It is not needed to purchase additional booster packs to construct decks before play (strongest advantage in comparison to trading card games). All strategic potential of the game is in one box. The game offers many different tactical situations to solve, free-time fun with friends and possibility to meet people during organized play events.

item.description:
The players have to travel from Lindau around the Bodensee to Bregenz, where they continue the trip by boat. Movement is determined bay a die. The first player to reach one of the 6 golden harbors with the exact roll of the die wins the game. 
The game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.

In Operación: Zombies Perú, each player plays the role of a Chief of Operations who must deal with what he has to rescue as many Civil Groups crammed and hidden throughout the city. Players must work as fast as they can because once all the needed helicopters arrive, the city will be abandoned and only the civil groups on the Rescue Zone will be saved. You can hinder your opponents' rescue missions by sending zombies to slow their work.

On each turn you draw a card and you play a card, taking into account that you can't have less the one card on your hand at the end of your turn. You play cards against your opponents or to help yourself keep safe your Civil Groups.

Operación: Zombies Perú finishes when a certain amount of helicopters are placed in different Rescue Zones.

This game is filled with laughter as you try to remain untouched and hinder your opponents at the same time.

item.description:
A fun and simple Western themed dice tabletop game, meant for 2 players ages 8 and up, that can be played anytime and anywhere.

Each player starts out with one bullet (red or blue dice) in their chamber. Each dice has a barrel, bullet, BANG. Each roll scores. For instance if Red rolls a barrel and blue rolls a bullet, blue scores as red is "hiding" in the barrel. If both roll bullets, each get a point. Each six rolls equals one round. Winner is the player who wins the most rounds. If both roll BANG, both miss each other and no one scores.

Quick, easy, filler game.

Yeti is a quick family dice game with extraordinary components and funny illustrations.

In Yeti players are competing adventurers and mountaineers, looking for traces of the Yeti, the legendary Snowman in the Himalaya. They want to find its footprints — or even better take photos of it — in order to collect points. To achieve this, they need to improve their equipment and acquire the help of Sherpas to lead them up the mountains. Most importantly, though, they should hope for good weather because if too much snow falls, the search of all players comes to a halt...

item.description: Undertome is a horror themed strategy card game comprised of 100 unique cards which players draw from a single deck (The Tome). Each card has a different effect which players must carefully choose to play during their turn because once a spell has been cast, the page is burned in the ashes never to be used again (or is it?). Players have a limited amount of Courage which they must guard as once you lose it, you are filled with overwhelming dread taking you out of the game.

A children's game with an electronic device that allows one of the three to four players to let a farting sound occur. It's then the others players job to decide which player "farted" and the farting player's job to deceive the others about his fart.

24 cards, each of them showing four bubbles in four different colours (red, green, blue, yellow), are laid out on the table. Four dice, in the same colours, are rolled. Their faces show values from 1 to 24. All players then simultaneously try to find the card on which the bubbles' sizes match the die roll. E. g. if the green die shows the highest value, the blue one the second highest, the red one the third highest and the yellow one the lowest, players have to find the card on which the green bubble is the biggest, the yellow one is the smallest etc. The player who is first to find the correct card puts it in front of him/herself. If the same combination is rolled again, another player can steal the card.
The first player to collect (and keep!) four cards wins the game.

Art by Luka Rejec - an amazing artist and gamer in Switzerland.
Inspiration comes from Drew Chamberlain (Dungeon Delve) and Nick Hayes (Utopia Engine).

The game consists of a board showing an 18 hole golf course which lists the par for each hole, 5 special 6 sided dice, one four sided die, four player tokens and four packs of 100 cards, one pack for each player.
 Holes are either par 3, 4 or 5 and there is a unique die for each par which the player rolls first on a hole. Depending on their roll result they will then have to roll a second time/die and depending on this result, may have to roll yet another die.
 Depending on the roll results players will select cards from their deck which record their scores. 
 After an agreed number of holes players add up their selected cards to determine their final score and the lowest wins.

Covering the Battle of Barents sea by solo.

A player controls the JW515B convoy to transport the supply to Murmansk. The German subs and air raids are controlled by the system using the playing cards.
